question: In a democratic system _______
explanation:
Legal sovereignty shouldn't be unquestionable because in a democratic system, the powers of the legislature should be subject to necessary executive and judicial review respectively for the sake of checks and balance and accountability

There is an explanation video available below.

question: That type of sovereignty that thrives on legitimacy is__________
explanation:
Legal sovereignty expresses his will in legal terms. This means it can only declare according to law the will of the state.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: vested on any form of government

question: The right of a citizen to seek redress means the right to________
explanation:
Seek an appeal under another judgement is the best answer because,  ''the right to seek redress'' is a fundamental element of rule of law. It means that aggrieved parties should be afforded the opportunity to have their cases re-examined especially by a court of higher authority.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: seek an appeal under another judgement

question: An order compelling a lower court or public corporation to perform in accordance with legitimacy is called_________
explanation:
Writ (i.e Order) of Mandamus is usually issued to mandate a public authority to perform its statutory or the functions tied to its establishment. On the alternative, the great writ means the habeas corpus writ issued to order the release of a body or person unlawfully detained or imprisoned to stand judgement

There is an explanation video available below.

question: A form of government which has its slogan to be 'ruling of the best' is__________
explanation:
Aristocracy being a rule by the Noble is believed to be a ruling of the best class of persons. Timocracy on the other hand, is believed by Aristotle to be a government strictly by property-owners with emphasis on honour and proprietary interest holdings.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: Deconcentration of power means the_______
explanation:
Deconcentration involves the passing down of selected administrative functions to lower levels or units within government agencies or departments with the centre remaining in control

Like the series of political office arrangements and portfolios in the Hausa/Fulani Empire i.e the Galadima, Waziri and the rest, deconcentration of power is obtainable unlike in devolution which Options B and D implicitly cover. Option A refers to the Decentralization of powers.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: sharing of powers among tiers of government
creation of semi autonomous units to govern other parts of a state
process of setting strategies or policies for the subsidiary territories in the state by putting recognized personnel in place
act of delegating powers and authority to component units that exist in a state

question: The concept of the independence of the judiciary means that________
explanation:
Strictly speaking, independence of the judiciary isn't restricted to the idea of non-interference by the legislature or executive or either of agencies on judicial decision making but particularly ensuring that all the gateways to the activities that may put the judiciary in a vulnerable state to the other arms of government must be shut down.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: The judiciary must not attempt to meddle into legislative and executive affairs
The powers of the courts can not be subjected of executive re-assessment
The sanctity of the office of the Judges and Justices must be preserved without prejudice
All means of legislative or executive influence on judicial decision making must be disabled

question: The political party serves as________
explanation:
The functional essence of political parties is to ensure that eventually the interests, entitlements and aspirations of the nation are realised through the emergence of a responsible government.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: A platform upon which the rights and liberties of the people can be attained
The group aggregating the interest of all in the state
A platform for rebelling against military rule

question: A party can be said to have national outlook if________
explanation:
Unlike the ethnic based philosophy, nature or outlook of the Action Group, Northern Peoples Congress in the First Republic, a multi-ethnic and all embracing political party is that with a Nation wide outlook

There is an explanation video available below.
options: it is ethnic based but has branches all over the state
its membership cut across ethnic boundaries
it is registered by the electoral commission as a national party
it is headed by individuals who are famous within and without the country

question: Argumentation, negotiation and deliberation on the subject matter of a bill begins at the_______
explanation:
At the second stage or reading of a bill, the debate on the subject matter of concern of the bill begins, this process becomes heightened at the Third Stage and particularly at the Committee Stage.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: A vote of no confidence means______
explanation:
vote of no confidence; a vote showing that a majority does not support the policy of a leader or governing body.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: the same as impeachment in a presidential system
the ability of the head of state to dissolve the parliament when collective responsibility fails to hold
the act of showing disapproval to the prime minister having breached the collective responsibility doctrine
the disapproval with dismissal in effect, the ministers and its head

question: A cabinet re-shuffle takes place......
explanation:
The membership of the Cabinet will be substituted or reshuffled especially when there is dissolution of the cabinet in its entirely in a WestMinster system.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: only when a motion of no confidence is passed
when prorogation and collective responsibility have their way
when the shadow cabinet fails in its effectiveness

question: Popular political participation means________
explanation:
The sum total of all activities exerted by the majority with enthusiasm actively involving in all aspects of their political sphere is the best answer not only because is the all-encompassing answer but also because popular political participation is the aggregation of all efforts of the citizens partaking deliberately and consciously in their governance affairs.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: having majority of the people partaking in politics
having a good number of voters in the electoral process
the aggregate efforts of more than half of the citizens to partake in public debate and politics
the sum total of all activities exerted by the majority with enthusiasm actively involving in all aspects of their political sphere

question: The area from which one or more members or representatives are elected in public offices is called the electoral ........
explanation:
Constituency is the definition for the political area from which an individual is elected into a representative office.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: Citizenship by naturalization________
explanation:
Citizenship by naturalization provides the medium for non-citizens who have satisfied or fulfilled the requirements of good citizenship according to a State Law, to become Citizens.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: is the same as citizenship by marriage and registeration
refers to the process of attaining citizenship through honorary means
is the act of a non-citizen having satisfied the constitutional criteria becoming a legal member of a state
is the medium by which an alien through the judiciary receives certification and attains citizenship by birth

question: The last measure used by the pressure groups issuing a condition to be satisfied within a stipulated time is called_______
explanation:
Pressure groups commonly issued deadlines(ultimatum) for the government to fulfill their requests and queries before embarking on strike action.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: Generally, a political party with only manifestoes without fulfillment is a/an _____
explanation:
Elitist is often used as a critique label, to describe a political party definitive of social class and rankings of top profiled politicians without much agenda for social justice.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: A form of government organized by a council of military officers is called______
explanation:
A military junta is a term sufficient to define an assembly of rulership organised by a council of militatry officers especially after a successful coup.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: The non-stratified society in the pre-colonial era was that of the ........ where decisions were made________
explanation:
The Igbo precolonial was seen as ''headless'' and decisions were made based on popular consultations and acceptability.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: The Hausa/Fulani Empire as a result of its heterogeneous population adopted_________
explanation:
The hausa/fulani empire for geo-political reasons apportioned different portfolios of authorities for serve the multiplicity of functions and administrative interests. The offices of Sarkin fada, as head of palace workers, Waziri as prime minister among others are pointers in this regard.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: A unitary system where full concentration of power prevailed
A federal structure where powers were decentralized although autocratic
A quasi federal structure with devolution
A partial federal set up with deconcentration

question: Twelve States creation is a reknown achievement of the ... regime
explanation:
Yakubu Gowon created 12 states for Nigeria in 1967.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: The basis of the Nigerian foreign policy thrust particularly during the Independence Constitution era was ... in nature
explanation:
Afrocentrism is the term used to describe the nature and interests of the Nigerian foreign policy targets withy preference for African neighboring States.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: The Brussel conference in 1889/90 was based on______
explanation:
The Brussel Conference unlike the Berlin Conference was targeted at the reconsideration of the unjust virtues and vices occasioned by colonialism, thereby specifically seeking to eradicate slave trade and related activities.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: putting an end to slave trade
furthering the decision on colonialism as previously discussed in the Berlin conference
deciding on how to penetrate Africa for economic adventurism

question: According to Lewis Samuel, 'is identified with pure conquest and unequivocal exploitation...'
explanation:
The ideology of regressive imperialism is pure economic advantage and enrichment of the imperialists devoid of any ethical consideration.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: One of the major defects of the Nigerian council which necessitated its replacement was that....
explanation:
The unrepresentative nature and figurehead stance of the Nigerian Council's membership is a stand-alone reason for the flaw of the platform. Most members were Whites who didn't understand the interests of the people they seek to govern.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: the meetings of the council were poorly attended
the council could only make law for the southern protectorate
the executive council was powerful than it

question: An important provision of the 1946 constitution was that it ........
explanation:
The Authur Richard Constitution of 1946 set the foundational road map for a full fledged federalism for Nigeria starting essentially with the Lyttleton's 1954 Constitution, and built upon thereafter.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: introduced official majority in the legislative council for the 1st time
for the 1st time, introduced the office of the head of government at the regional level

question: In the all-Nigerian constitutional conference of 1950________
explanation:
Recognizing and acknowledging the relative importance of direct participation and contribution by people in their own affairs, the All-Nigerian Constitutional Conference marked an unprecendented attendance of all previously relegated unofficial members of the local legislature.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: all official members of the legislative council participated
it was resolved that the Nigerians federation be organized on ethnic basis
it was concluded that a quasi-federal structure should be developed for colonial Nigeria
all unofficial members of the legislative council participated

question: Implementations of the target programmes of the government is the primary duty of the _____ a part of the _____
explanation:
The Civil Service is an integral branch of the public service which primarily functions to implement the policies of the government.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: The most recent target plans and agenda of the United Nations are known as the______
explanation:
The 17 United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) are the most recent aspirational global agenda for the sake of environmental sustainability, strong governance institutions and partnerships among related others.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: The federal judge under the 1963 constitution could be removed by the______
explanation:
2/3 majority support or vote of the National Assembly members was enough under the 1963 Constitution to remove a federal judge.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: Under the 1999 constitution, the Chief Law Officer and the Supreme Court Judge respectively are the_______
explanation:
The Attorney General of the Federation is the same as the Minister of Justice while the judge at the Supreme Court level is the Chief Justice.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: Chief Registrar of the Supreme Court, Chief Justice

question: Which of the following was not responsible for the coalition between A. G and N. C. N. C.?
explanation:
All the following options facilitated the coalition of the action Group and the National Council of the Nigerian Citizens except the The Kano Riot of 1953

There is an explanation video available below.
options: Awolowo's faction seeking to get N. P. C. out of power as opposed to Akintola's option
contest for the federal election of 1964
Akintola's faction which broke out of A. G. to form UPP

question: In the 4th republic, the political parties were______
explanation:
With a multiparty system, the three political parties in 4th Republic were the Peoples Democratic Party, All Progressive Grand Alliance and the Alliance for Democracy.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: The Economic and Financials Crime Commission (EFCC) scope and nature of duty may not extend to_______
explanation:
The EFCC as it is, is an executive body that must discharge its functions strictly in line with the reasons for its establishment. None of those functions extend to exercising judicial powers by punishing and conducting trials for suspects, which the strict duty of the court.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: arresting suspects of cyber crime and online fraud
arresting the giver and the taker in a corruption case
conducting trials and punishing persons involved in corruption matters
investigating cases of substance and drug abuse intersecting with money laundering

question: The Green Revolution programme was the effected manifesto of the ........ in 1979
explanation:
The National Party of Nigeria (NPN) is popularly known for its Green Revolution agricultural project in the late 1979s.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: Nigeria's federalism is often considered a flaw along the standard test of the Classical federalism ideology labelled along with_______
explanation:
Kenneth Clinton Wheare is noted to having postulated that the fundamental, negotiable element of federalism is voluntary submission of rights by the component units in a federal set up.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: The most representative organ of the united nations is the_______
explanation:
General Assembly. The UN General Assembly comprises the Heads of State and Government of all the State Parties in the UN body.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: Executive Council of the African Union makes decision by_______
explanation:
The Council of Ministers of the State Parties of the AU, the Executive Council makes decision primarily by consensus or by 2/3 majority support.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: the veto of the General Secretariat

question: Amendment of the U. N. O. charter is the duty of the ........
explanation:
The UN General Assembly has the duty of amending relevant provisions of the UN Charter.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: The fact that the office of the Chairman is rotational in ECOWAS makes it a perfect example of a/an ........
explanation:
A Collegiate is used to describe a rotational system of governance within a specific circle of qualified practitioners or representatives.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: The newspaper established by Dr. Nnamdi Azikiwe to project the interest of nationalists was__________
explanation:
The West African Pilot was the newspaper of Dr Azikiwe which served as a medium for propagating nationalist ideas and solidarity movements towards self-realization.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: The delineation of electoral constituencies for reasons of political advantage is termed___________
explanation:
Gerrymandering is the process of creating political constituencies in order to favour the electoral scores of a political party.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: A predominant feature of the Precolonial governance system was that_________
explanation:
Throughout the precolonial era in Nigeria, the native laws of the people governed them. They were largely unwritten and enforced by distinct units set in place for those purposes.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: the British Indirect rule system penetrated it largely
the governance structures were largely undefined

question: In most recent times, a seemingly workable solution to the Nigerian federal question is that of_______
explanation:
Although Options A, B and C are recurring options for the Nigerian federalism, the clarion call for restructuring is louder than ever before.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: The concept of delegated legislation is often criticised for all but one of the following reasons?
explanation:
Delegated Legislation is supported largely because certain specialist idea is needed for the purpose of rule making on areas upon which the legislature may not have sufficient knowledge and skill in. Example, the INEC is empowered to make election guidelines and regulations aside the Electoral Act and in furtherance of its duties.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: it may lead to abuse of the powers
for reasons of sheer ignorance on legislative substance and procedure
for reasons of expertise rule making on specific subject matters
it is a clear violation of the separation of powers concept

question: ____ is noted for having said "man by nature is a political animal"
explanation:
According to Aristotle, every human interaction intersects with political determinations and interests.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: The term ultra vires means_________
explanation:
A public authority is said to have ultra vires when it has acted beyond the boundaries of its duties as provided for in its enabling law or as prescribed by the Executive.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: the exercise of supervisory functions by the judiciary
a situation where a public authority dutifully performs its functions
a situation where a public authority acts beyond the scope of its duties
the act of exercising administrative competence over a matter

question: Class stratification is a peculiar feature of___________
explanation:
In a capitalist system, there is a clear differentiation gap between the ruling class and the ruled or the proletarates.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: One of the following reasons is unlikely to necessitate the emergence of a federal system?
explanation:
Other Options are necessary reasons for the adoption of a federal system except for sake of defining or strengthening the political sovereignty which invariably belongs to the citizens.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: Lobbying is often a strategy adopted by________
explanation:
Pressure groups often adopt lobbying as a negotiation mechanism with critical governement stakeholders and or legislators so that significant policies and laws giving effect to their interests are implemented.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: A political party often with a radical viewpoint and perspective to sensitive state affairs matters is often labelled as a ___party
explanation:
A liberal political party often seeks to argue for change and transformation of the present state of things in a state including those matters of relative social and economic importance.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: Opinion sampling may be necessary for the following reasons except________
explanation:
To inspire public reasoning on population census is the best answer, as it is the least reason why opinion sampling mechanisms, by way of online survey or through opinion polls are organised.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: for aggregating popular thinking and standpoint on a subject matter
to evaluate the political strength of a political party
to inspire public reasoning on population census

question: The defining processes for the formation of a people's political behaviour is___________
explanation:
Political socialisation refers to the series of learning processes and experiences which serve to sharpen the orientation and perspective of the people to their democratic affairs.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: The ____ Reform is influential to the inception of Local Government in Nigeria
explanation:
The Murtala/Obasanjo 1976 Reform necessitated the discovery of the essence of a local government council and establishment.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: Colonialist arrival in Nigeria is traceable particularly to the_____
explanation:
It must be stated with emphatic clarity that the annexation of Lagos as a 'Colony' in 1861 is significant to the effectuation of colonialism in Nigeria. All the other factors of economic advantage and the spread of christianity are complementary and implied reasons.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: introduction of the indirect rule policy

question: The Indigenat Policy is attributable to the ___
explanation:
The obnoxious policy of assimilation and direct rule was adopted in the French Colonies.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: The solidarity for self-governance system and liberty of Africans demonstrated by Africans and Non-Africans in diaspora is termed__________
explanation:
Pan-Africanism is the ideology upheld by a wide majority of the advocates for the independence of African States during the colonialism era and beyond.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: Acceleration of the independence movements in the British West African Colonies was essentially because of the________
explanation:
The tolerance posture for the development of political parties and interest groups in the British West African Colonies spurred the pace of the drive for their autonomy.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: posture of the British Governor Generals
tolerance for political participation and demonstration through political parties
speedy grant of independence in the French Colonies

question: The cultural organisation which metamorphosed into the Northern People's Congress (NPC) was__________
explanation:
The Northern People's Congress was an offshoot of the Jamiyyar Mutanen Arewa.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: The legitimate claims and entitlements available by reasons of birth and residence and/or certification, to a community of people may be abscribed as their___________
explanation:
Citizenship rights are the legal privileges and opportunities available to the citizens of a State. Examples, only citizens are eligible to contest elections and own properties in Nigeria. Fundamental rights and civil liberties are an aggregation of their individual and collective entitlements by reasons of being human.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: A moral or legal conviction for the observance of the constitution may be described as________
explanation:
Constitutionalism is the term used to describe compliance with the provisions of the constitution.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: The primary essence of a public corporation is__________
explanation:
Public Corporations are essentially created to provide infrastructure for the public benefit or interest.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: for the formulation of government policies
for the resolution of administrative disputes

question: The principle that determines the pattern of interaction of a country in international politics is known as____________
explanation:
The foreign policy thrust of a state defines its delibrate and strategic plan of actions in interaction with other states.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: The arm of government responsible for the approval of war is the_____
explanation:
While declaration of war is the duty of the executive, the legislature approves or disapproves of it as embarking on war means and requires additional expenditure and budget scrutiny.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: The West African Students' Union (WASU) was formed in____________
explanation:
WASU was formed by Chief Ladipo Solanke among others in 1925.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: The Chick's commission was set up to look into the issue of revenue allocation in___________
explanation:
As part of the Commissions set up for the review of the Nigerian federalism challenges, the Chick's commission was set up in 1953.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: The head of the districts in the Hausa/Fulani Empire were the_________
explanation:
The Hakimi was the titled administrative officers in charge of the districts in the heterogeneous Hausa/Fulani Empire.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: Under the 1979 constitution of Nigeria, each State was allowed to elect________
explanation:
Unlike the position under the present 1999 Constitution as amended, each state was permitted to elect 5 senators into the House of Representatives.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: from two to five senators depending on the population
as many senators as the state could finance.

question: The Armed Forces Ruling Council (AFRC) is attributable to the ____ regime
explanation:
Unlike the Supreme Military Council of the Muhammadu Buhari's military regime, the AFRC is attributtable to the Babangida's regime.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: The dwindling and market falls in oil prices are prime indicators for Nigeria politico-economic consideration for________
explanation:
In most recent times, the prevalent politico-economic discussions in Nigeria has been on the need for economic diversification for reasons of economic boom and social transformation.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: the adoption of the United Nations' Vision 2030

question: Nigeria's top contribution to Africa's agenda of decolonisation and anti-racism was mostly enhanced with the formation of the_________
explanation:
In the wake of the call for the decolonisation of Africa, Nigeria actively contributed to the formation of the OAU for a solidarity movement in that direction.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS)

question: One of the following political parties produced Nigeria's first Prime Minister_______
explanation:
NPC was the party of Tafawa Balewa, Nigeria's first prime minister.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: The National Assembly in the second republic was made up of the________
explanation:
The Chambers of the National Assembly since 1979 are the House of Representatives and the Senate respectively.

There is an explanation video available below.
options: House of Chiefs and the Senate
Lower House and the House of Representatives
Senate and the House of Lords

question: The All Progressives Congress (APC) is the result of a coalition of the following parties except the___________
explanation:
APC is the result of the merger of the parties in options A, B, and D including a faction of the All Progressives Grand Alliance (APGA).

There is an explanation video available below.

question: The process by which electorates remove elected official is called_________
explanation:
The power of impeachment belongs to the legislature to check the Executive act of gross misconduct while Re-call is exercisable within the reach of the electorates.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: The Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC) is an organ of the_________
explanation:
ECOSOC is an organ of the UN basically concerned with matters of economic and socio-cultural importance to the global community.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: Nigeria joined the Organisation of Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) in__________
explanation:
Nigeria joined OPEC in 1971 during Yakubu Gowon's military regime.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: The International Criminal Court (ICC) has its headquarters in__________
explanation:
The ICC sits at the Hagues, Netherlands and has jurisdiction over matters of international crimes e.g. genocide, war crimes etc.

There is an explanation video available below.

question: The current Secretary-General of the United Nations is_________
explanation:
Antonio Guterres, a Portuguese diplomat is the ninth serving Secretary-General of the United Nations.

There is an explanation video available below.
